content.definition: Third most common visceral aneurysm. High risk of rupture and bowel infarction due to critical nature of SMA blood supply. Often mycotic in origin (infective endocarditis). Treatment requires maintaining intestinal perfusion through bypass or reconstruction.

treatment.principles: Must maintain SMA flow to prevent bowel infarction
endovascular: Coil embolization only if adequate collateral
Not preferred for main SMA trunk

clinical_pearls: SMA aneurysm = high risk - cannot sacrifice main SMA without consequence
50% are mycotic - look for endocarditis source
Open reconstruction preferred - endovascular limited by need for flow preservation
PTA pseudoaneurysms should also exclude pancreatic disease
